node.title: Judge rejects Trump bid to stop House committee from seeing his tax returns
node.alt: Donald Trump gets into a car.
node.description: A United StatesÂ judge says former president Donald Trump was "wrong on the law" in seeking to block the House Ways and Means Committee from obtaining his tax returns.
node.content: ["A United States\u00a0judge has dismissed a bid by former president Donald Trump to keep his tax returns from a House of Representatives committee.", "US\u00a0District Judge Trevor McFadden said in his ruling on Tuesday that Mr Trump was \"wrong on the law\" in seeking to block the House Ways and Means Committee from obtaining his tax returns.", "Judge McFadden \u2014\u00a0who also said it was within the power of the committee's chairman to publish the returns if he saw fit \u2014\u00a0put his ruling on hold for 14 days, allowing time for an appeal.", "Mr Trump was the first president in 40 years not to release his tax returns as he aimed to keep secret the details of his wealth and the activities of his family company, the Trump Organization.", "The committee sued in 2019 to force disclosure of the tax returns, and the dispute lingers nearly 11 months after Trump left office.", "Trump lawyer Patrick Strawbridge told Judge McFadden last month that the committee had no legitimate reason to see the tax returns and had asked for them in the hope of uncovering information that could hurt Mr Trump politically.", "Mr Strawbridge did not respond to a request for comment on the ruling.", "House Democrats have said they need Mr Trump's tax returns to see if the Internal Revenue Service was properly auditing presidential returns in general and to assess whether new legislation was needed.", "\"I am pleased that we're now one step closer to being able to conduct more thorough oversight of the IRS's mandatory presidential audit program,\" House Ways and Means Committee Chairman Richard Neal said in a statement.", "Judge McFadden, a Trump appointee, said the committee would be able to accomplish its stated objective without publishing the returns.", "He cautioned Mr Neal that, while he had\u00a0the right to do so, \"anyone can see that publishing confidential tax information of a political rival is the type of move that will return to plague the inventor\".", "AP"]
